intro: Baeothryon cespitosum, commonly known as the tufted baeothryon, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and has a rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered, forming a dense, tuft-like structure at the top of the plant. Baeothryon cespitosum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
